page.title: 16FARMING AROUND WOODSTOCK
page.content: Hensington Farm, Shipton Slade Farm and Weavely Farm are all run by Mr Brooks. Most of his land is rented from the Duke of Marlborough. He keeps cattle and sheep and grows wheat, oilseed rape and barley. Weavely Farm is owned by Mrs Clothier's daughters. They own 43 acres and have 30 Jersey cows, 14 for milking together with 12 beef cattle and four calves. They have 150 semi free-range chickens. They get 120 litres of milk a day and send the cream to a creamery in Long Handborough. They grow 10-acres of barley and apart from their one tractor and milking parlour they have no machinery. Other machines are obtained though contract hire. They have two cats and used to run a tea room at the farm. On these farms can be found some of the local wildlife including, mink, hedgehogs, hares, otters and mice
